title: Deadlock Grows Uglier as Congress Heads Toward Government Shutdown
summary: President Trump’s posting of a deepfake video mocking and insulting the top two Democrats in Congress underscored the lack of progress toward any deal to extend funding.

title: Trump and Hegseth Recount Familiar Partisan Complaints to Top Military Leaders
summary: The U.S. generals and admirals summoned from around the world had been given little information about the planned event.

title: Hegseth Lectures Military Brass on ‘Woke’ Leaders, Fitness and Grooming
summary: Senior officers, summoned from around the world, are entrusted to manage complex military operations. They got a lecture on fitness and grooming standards.

title: Gov. Jeff Landry Wants National Guard Troops Deployed in Louisiana
summary: Gov. Jeff Landry’s request to the Trump administration highlights how Republican-led states are embracing the president’s push to use the Guard to crack down on crime.

title: With New U.S. Proposal to End Gaza War, a Rare Moment of Triumph for Netanyahu
summary: In President Trump’s plan, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu got almost everything he hoped for in the end, despite mounting international isolation.

title: Ambassador Mike Huckabee Postpones Rare Visit to Egypt
summary: Ambassador Huckabee said the delay was requested by Egyptian officials. The trip is now expected to take place in the coming weeks.

title: Trump Pardon Ended Probe Into Green Beret’s Killing of Suspected Taliban Bombmaker. Was Justice Served?
summary: The president’s pardon of Mathew Golsteyn cut short an investigation into his killing of a man he believed to be a Taliban bombmaker. Was justice served?

title: Inside the U.S. Special Forces: 5 Takeaways on a Culture of Lawlessness in Afghanistan
summary: Until now, many of the troubling events that took place during the war in Afghanistan have been shrouded in secrecy.

title: Trinity Church’s New Organ in Manhattan Is Shaking the Pews
summary: Trinity’s organ was severely damaged in the Sept. 11 attacks. At last, its replacement has been unveiled. Hear the sound of its 8,041 pipes.

title: The Artist Who Lived in a Cage For a Year
summary: At Dia Beacon, a retrospective looks at the career of Tehching Hsieh, whose yearlong performance art pieces were some of the most grueling the medium has ever seen.

title: In Unusual Move, Prosecutors Secure Federal Charges From Local Grand Jury
summary: A judge, Zia M. Faruqui, said that what appeared to be a kind of grand jury forum shopping seemed to have broken “decades-long norms and the rule of law.”

title: Eric Adams’s Campaign Is Over. His Campaign Finance Problems Are Not.
summary: City regulators are focusing on potential fund-raising irregularities that could result in the clawback of $10 million from Mr. Adams’s 2021 mayoral campaign.

title: How Zohran Mamdani Built a Campaign Around Food
summary: The front-runner for New York mayor is leveraging his lifelong love of eating to inform his policy plans and spread his message.

title: Breaking Down the Mayor’s Race After Adams’s Exit
summary: Plus, what elected officials from across the country have to say about the race.

title: Secretive Program That Keeps Ukraine’s Weapons Firing Is Suddenly in Doubt
summary: A Czech Republic-led effort gathers munitions for Kyiv from around the world, but an opposition party expected to win elections there has vowed to drop it.

title: A.I. Fighter Jets and Cockroach Spies: Inside the Changing Business of War
summary: Russia’s war on Ukraine changed the course of a generation of start-ups and investors that have applied a new business model to Europe’s military buildup.

title: Russia’s Military Budget Shrinks as War Costs Hit Kremlin’s Economic Limits
summary: The budget indicates that Russia will continue to fight largely as it has, locking it in a grinding war of attrition.

title: Top A.I. Researchers Leave OpenAI, Google and Meta for New Start-Up
summary: Founded by a co-creator of ChatGPT, Periodic Labs aims to build artificial intelligence that can accelerate discoveries in physics, chemistry and other fields.

title: What We Know About ChatGPT’s New Parental Controls
summary: OpenAI said parents can set time and content limits on accounts and receive notifications if ChatGPT detects signs of potential self-harm.

title: The War in Gaza Needs to End
summary: The war needs to end, for the sake of the Gazan people and for the sake of Israel and its security.

title: The Logic of Vaccine Hesitancy in a Broken Health System
summary: Why parents are trusting themselves over the experts.

title: Trump’s Plan to End the War in Gaza
summary: We look at the plan and American public opinion polls on the war.

title: Pope Leo Plans to Speak on Climate Change
summary: The address comes 10 years after his predecessor’s groundbreaking statement on global warming. His words will be watched for signals on the direction of the new papacy.

title: Starmer Describes ‘Fight for the Soul’ of U.K. as Populist Right Rises
summary: In a speech at an annual Labour conference, the British prime minister contrasted his political project with that of Nigel Farage, whose Reform party promises mass deportations.

title: Second Victim of Dallas ICE Shooting Dies
summary: A house painter who had been in the United States for two decades had been critically injured in Dallas by a gunman who the government said was aiming at federal law enforcement officers.

title: How Chinese Weapons Transformed a War Between Two Neighbors
summary: China urged Cambodia and Thailand to end their border war in July. But weeks earlier, it had sent rockets and artillery shells to Cambodia, Thai intelligence documents show.
